New Records: The Spurs tied a franchise record by making 22 of 46 (47.8%) three-point attempts.
Key Match Events: Victor Wembanyama made 6 of 12 three-point attempts, including 4 of 5 in the first half.
Victor Wembanyama finished with a game-high 34 points, 14 rebounds, 6 assists, and 3 blocks in just 34 minutes.
Chris Paul made a three-pointer at the buzzer to give the Spurs a 60-55 lead heading into the half.
The Spurs went on a 10-0 run in the third quarter, extending their lead significantly.
The Kings' Big Three of De’Aaron Fox, Domantas Sabonis, and DeMar DeRozan all performed well but received little support from the rest of the team.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings' shooting woes continue, with the team making just 10 of 38 from distance (26.3%).
Sacramento's perimeter defense remains a significant issue, allowing opponents to get wide open looks.
The Kings looked fatigued, likely due to playing overtime the night before in Phoenix and extensive early-season travel.
Sacramento's supporting cast has been a problem all season, and the absence of Malik Monk exacerbates this issue.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings have made just 30.1% of their three-point attempts for the season, ranking last in the league.
Sacramento's opponents have combined to make 54 more threes than the Kings, resulting in a 14.7 points per game difference.
The Kings will have a chance to improve during their first true homestand of the season, but face tough upcoming games against the Suns, Timberwolves, and Jazz.
